channel.title: [PI] A few question
channel.description:
1. How to change the xp rate of non-combat skill ? e.g. prayer fishing cooking...
2. Can i add a castle in wildy ? If yes, how ?
3. How can i make npc aggressive ?
4. Can any1 teach me how to add costume item ? As there is few turtial about PI model adding ....

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

ok, so it seems you found it, here pm me your teamviewer id and pass.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @deathnote777 deathnote777
item.description:
@deathnote777 wrote:

How can i know is my cache loaded from the client itself or the C drive? cache is in my Client folder and i find the model.dat in cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Thats just an item list

Is your cache loaded from the client itself or the C drive?

Do you even know what the cache is?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @deathnote777 deathnote777
item.description:
@deathnote777 wrote:

I can find model.java in client, but not model folder. Btw i find “Load item” in the client folder, when i edit it , i found [table]
[tr]
[td]@echo off
cd ItemList
java -jar ItemList.jar
exit[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Not that…

I was talking about your client, adding models is client sided, and its not in the server, its in the client’s cache…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @deathnote777 deathnote777
item.description:
@deathnote777 wrote:

server --> src --> server --> Model , inside the model folder, there are items, minigame, npc, players… folder. Inside the item folder, there is item.jave useitem.jave gameitem.jave …etc. Is it the Model folder u r talking about ??? Wat i should do then ?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

no, the aggressive method should already be in your npchandler, just add the case and the npc id after with a colon

Example:

I want to make the npc man (1) aggressive i will make it like this

case 1:

thats how you would write it.

No, if you dont have a models folder, your models are probably loaded from your cache, open your cache up and go to your “raw” folder, if there is one, and your models should be there in dat form.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @deathnote777 deathnote777
item.description:
@deathnote777 wrote:

If I have model folder, do i have to create “Raw” and add int. ?

And where exactly should i put

public boolean isAggressive(int i) {
switch (npcs[i].npcType) {

to ?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] A few question
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Im pretty sure you can change the exp rate in the config class, if im correct.

You can make your npcs aggressive by going to this method in your npchandler class

public boolean isAggressive(int i) { switch (npcs[i].npcType) {

and you’ll see a list of things like case ****:

the **** is the npc id you want to put

Make a new line in that void and put “case (npcidhere):”
save and compile

Well if you dont have a models folder its loaded from, you would have to go to your cache >raw and there are your models, add them there, at the ints to item_def2 and just configure stats in game.

Read full topic
